reasons.title: Opportunity Zone Benefits
reasons.description: Leverage the Qualified Opportunity Fund structure to defer existing gains and eliminate all capital gains tax on the project's appreciation after a 10-year hold.

reasons.title: Severe Supply Shortage
reasons.description: Yavapai County faces a declared housing crisis with a 4,500+ unit deficit, ensuring high demand and stable occupancy for Class A multifamily assets.

reasons.title: Vertical Integration Advantage
reasons.description: A strategic partnership with FrameTec, located just 2 miles from the site, provides a proprietary supply chain for critical components to mitigate cost overruns.

summary.quote: The Town of Camp Verde recognizes the national housing crisis and its significant and growing impact on individuals and families across all income levels.
paragraphs: TierraMark at Camp Verde is a 176-unit Class A multifamily development designed to address the critical workforce housing shortage in Yavapai County, Arizona. Situated on 6.75 acres, the project features 11 residential buildings with modern one, two, and three-bedroom floorplans and resort-style community amenities. The development is positioned to capture surging regional demand in a market characterized by 95%+ occupancy rates and annual rent growth exceeding 8%.

The investment is structured as a Qualified Opportunity Fund, providing investors with significant tax protection including the complete elimination of capital gains tax on appreciation after a 10-year hold period. The development team is vertically integrated through local partnerships, including a nearby manufacturing facility for structural components and an experienced general contractor. Pro-forma projections target an investor IRR of 18-20% and an equity multiple of up to 3.08x upon exit.
summary.conclusion: This project offers a unique combination of high-yield potential, defensive market positioning, and maximum tax efficiency through its Opportunity Zone designation.

cards.title: Financial Returns
cards.summary: Strong projected returns supported by aggressive regional rent growth and a tax-advantaged QOF exit strategy.

cards.title: Property Overview
cards.summary: A luxury Class A community featuring 11 buildings, a resort-style pool, clubhouse, and smart-home integrated interiors.

cards.title: Market Analysis
cards.summary: Camp Verde's declared housing crisis and a 35% workforce commute rate create a massive captive audience for new Class A units.

cards.title: Sponsor Profile
cards.summary: A local development team with a proven track record of delivering large-scale multifamily projects within the Yavapai County corridor.

projections.label: 10-Yr Equity Multiple

projections.label: Stabilized Yield on Cost

projections.label: Stabilized NOI

projections.label: Projected Exit Value

projections.label: Exit Cap Rate
projections.description: Assumed cap rate at sale (Year 10) per pro-forma; supports ~$72M exit valuation.

uses.description: Primary vertical construction and site work.
Fees and capitalized interest during development.

sources.description: LP Investors portion of the equity stack.
GP/Sponsor portion of the equity stack.

timeline.description: Project commencement, land purchase, and start of vertical construction.
Project reaches full occupancy; permanent financing replaces construction loan.
Ongoing rental income distributions to investors.
Strategic sale of the asset; full return of capital and split of appreciation profit.

benefits.title: Capital Gains Deferral
benefits.description: Investors can defer capital gains taxes on prior investments by reinvesting into this Qualified Opportunity Fund.

benefits.title: Basis Step-Up
benefits.description: Step-up in basis for the original capital gains investment after a 5 or 7 year hold.

benefits.title: Tax-Free Growth
benefits.description: 100% exemption on capital gains taxes from the appreciation of the TierraMark investment if held for at least 10 years.

saleWaterfall.description: Preferred return catch-up and unpaid capital returned first.
Splits of all remaining capital gains from appreciation.

cashFlowDistribution.description: Investors receive all cash flow until an 8% cumulative preferred return is met.
Remaining cash flow to LPs until 100% of initial capital is returned.
Remaining profits are split pro-rata based on the initial equity contribution.

refinancingWaterfall.description: Refinance proceeds used to return initial investor capital.

highlights.title: Major Employment Hub

highlights.title: High Rental Demand

marketAnalysis.pageSubtitle: Local economic drivers and competitive landscape

metrics.label: Annual Rent Growth
metrics.description: Annualized increase in rental rates for Yavapai County.

metrics.label: Class A Occupancy
metrics.description: Current occupancy rate reported for Class A multifamily in the region.

metrics.label: Housing Shortage
metrics.description: Total housing unit deficit to meet current demand in Yavapai County.

metrics.label: Projected Pop. Growth
metrics.description: Projected population increase for the region through 2035.

metrics.label: Tourism Spending Increase
metrics.description: Increase in regional visitor spending between 2019 and 2023.

metrics.label: Workforce Commute Rate
metrics.description: Percentage of Camp Verde's workforce currently forced to commute.

demographics.description: Workers living outside the area due to housing shortage

drivers.title: Legislative Support
drivers.description: The Town of Camp Verde declared a national housing crisis in 2025, streamlining land-use approvals to combat a 4,500+ unit deficit.

drivers.title: Supply Chain Advantage
drivers.description: Proximity to the FrameTec manufacturing plant (2 miles) ensures a stable supply of trusses and wall panels, de-risking construction timelines.

drivers.title: Opportunity Zone Benefits
drivers.description: Situate in a Qualified Opportunity Zone, providing long-term investors with capital gains deferral and tax-free appreciation.

drivers.title: Demographic Momentum
drivers.description: Camp Verde's population growth (22% since 2010) has outpaced housing production (12%), resulting in sustained 8% annual rent growth.

analysis.title: Growth Mismatch
analysis.description: Statewide population growth of 22% has vastly outpaced the 12% increase in housing units since 2010.

analysis.title: Inventory Compression
analysis.description: The local short-term rental market has absorbed traditional family housing, further compressing the long-term rental supply.

analysis.title: Latent Demand
analysis.description: Waitlists for local affordable apartments exceed 200 persons with extremely low turnover rates.

data.summary: The market is characterized by a severe supply-demand imbalance. Inspiration Apartments, a 192-unit Class A project completed in 2024, reached full occupancy immediately, signaling high demand for quality rentals. Local affordable options like Sycamore Vista maintain long waiting lists with rents starting at $1,850+, further validating the $1,915 target for TierraMark.

sectors.title: Healthcare & Medical Services
sectors.description: Major regional anchor with 3,400+ professionals serving 70,000 patients annually.

sectors.title: Professional & Business Services
sectors.description: Fastest growing sector in Yavapai County, projected at 2.9% annual growth.

sectors.title: Education & Research
sectors.description: Anchor institutions include NAU (1,115 staff) and Yavapai College (959 employees).

sectors.title: Leisure & Hospitality
sectors.description: Strong tourism sector with $89.3M in overnight stays and anchors like Cliff Castle Casino.

paragraphs: Landmark Asset Holdings, LLC presents TierraMark, a 176-unit Class A multifamily development located in a high-demand submarket of Camp Verde, Arizona. The project is uniquely positioned to address a critical workforce housing shortage in Yavapai County, where Class A occupancy rates exceed 95% and rental rates have seen an 8% annual growth.

The project utilizes an end-to-end development model where the sponsor acts as the turnkey manager, overseeing everything from initial site planning to final stabilization. Deep alignment is achieved through the General Partners' existing ownership and contribution of the land, which significantly de-risks the capital stack and streamlines the pre-development timeline.

items.text: Qualified Opportunity Fund with significant tax benefits
Strategic site in Camp Verde, AZ within Yavapai County
Vertically integrated team including local supply chain partners

partners.name: General Partner (Camp Verde Landmark Partners LLC)

advantages.title: End-to-End Model
advantages.description: Landmark Asset Holdings operates as a turnkey development manager, controlling every phase from acquisition to stabilization.

advantages.title: GP Land Ownership
advantages.description: The project land is fully owned by the General Partners, eliminating acquisition risks and providing strong collateral for financing.

advantages.title: Integrated Supply Chain
advantages.description: A partnership with the nearby FrameTec facility ensures a vertically integrated supply chain for trusses and panels, reducing cost and risk.

advantages.title: QOF Tax Efficiency
advantages.description: Structured as a Qualified Opportunity Fund, allowing investors to defer capital gains and eliminate taxes on appreciation after a 10-year hold.
